title: Want This Snoopy T-Shirt? You’ll Have to Pay in Blood.
description: The Red Cross teamed up with “Peanuts” for an April blood drive, and a T-shirt promoting the campaign has become an unexpectedly hot commodity online.

title: Twitter Takes Aim at Posts That Link to Its Rival Substack
description: Elon Musk’s company made the norm-shattering move two days after the publishing start-up Substack unveiled a Twitter-like service.

title: Hoping to Draw Moviegoers and Filmmakers, Amazon Heads to Theaters
description: The streaming company released Ben Affleck’s “Air” on 3,500 movie screens this week, and it plans to open 10 to 12 films theatrically every year.

title: How Elon Musk Is Changing the Twitter Experience
description: Nearly six months after buying Twitter, Mr. Musk has made tweaks that have altered what people see on the platform and how they interact with it.

title: In A.I. Race, Microsoft and Google Choose Speed Over Caution
description: Technology companies were once leery of what some artificial intelligence could do. Now the priority is winning control of the industry’s next big thing.

title: A.I. Vibe Check With Ezra Klein, and Kevin Tries Phone Positivity
description: How do you make sense of all the different philosophical camps surrounding A.I.?

title: Seduced by a Charming AI Chatbot
description: David was passionate, courteous and (artificially) intelligent.

title: Senior Twitter Lawyer Resigns, the Latest in a Series of Executive Departures
description: The lawyer had been closely involved in the company’s talks with the Federal Trade Commission over promises it had made on privacy.
